page.title: 02HOUSES IN BLACKROD
page.content: Blackrod is mainly a residential area. Most of the men travel to work. Since the{Second World War,}there has been much housing development - mainly private, but there is one{Council {Housing Estate.}The houses are mostly semi-detached with some bungalows, detached and terraced. { Barn Acre}is an interesting,small housing development that won a{Civic {Trust Award}in 1981. It consists of the{Green Barn Farm,}built in 1704 with{wattle and daub}inner walls. The old stone farm buildings have been developed into modern luxury homes around a cobbled courtyard - the old farmyard. The{tithe barn,}thought to date back to about 1587 has a{cruck {beam roof}which has been left exposed in the upstairs living accomodation in one of the three houses made from the barn.
